description: A Romano-British religious complex was revealed just 400m east of Watling Street during excavations. The complex included at least two Romano-Celtic temples and further structures.
bibliography: “Friars Wash, Redbourn, Hertfordshire. Archaeological Evaluation and Assessment of Results.,” 2009. https://doi.org/10.5284/1021923.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Friars Wash, Redbourn (Hertfordshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
